content.quote: Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.
content.author: H. G. Wells

content.quote: I've had a wonderful time, but this wasn't it.
content.author: Groucho Marx

content.quote: The significant problems we face cannot be solved at the same level of thinking we were at when we created them.
content.author: Albert Einstein

content.quote: When you do the common things in life in an uncommon way, you will command the attention of the world.
content.author: George Washington Carver

content.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
content.author: Thomas Alba Edison

content.quote: God is a comedian playing to an audience too afraid to laugh.
content.author: Voltaire

content.quote: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
content.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

content.quote: The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds, and the pessimist fears this is true.
content.author: James Branch Cabell

content.quote: We have art to save ourselves from the truth.
content.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content.quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.
content.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
